I found the documentation on SourceForge which said that if you want 
to us=
e python to run cantera, just run the binary installer.

So I:

1. Installe=
d Python 2.5
2. Ran the cantera msi
3. Ran the cantera setup from the cante=
ra folder
4. When I double-clicked on a python script a DOS console window =

flashed on the screen (no error message)
5. If I right click on a script a=
nd then choose to edit the script 
and then try to run it from the python c=
onsole:
   ImportError: No module named numarray.libnumeric
6. The offendin=
g line in the script is "import from Cantera *"
7. So I found the libnumeri=
c installer for python 2.5 and installed 
it.
8. Same problem.
9. Searched =
for answers in the forum, haven't found any (yet)

Has anyone used winxp an=
d python 2.5 and the cantera 1.7 msi and got 
it to work? If so, how did yo=
u do it? The installation instructions 
just say to run the installer. I fo=
und answers for matlab, but I 
don't have that, nor do I have a complier (a=
t least under winxp) so I 
need to get the winxp installer working with pyt=
hon.

I know next to nothing about python, so how do I tell if libnumeric 
=
is properly installed? I didn't see anything obvious on a quick 
glance of =
the python directory structure.
